column4: To install Ubuntu on a Acer aspire one , Slow or okey ?  Any possible way to add to grup to boot from netinstall iso ?
you can use netinstaller, yes
Possible to add netinstall.iso to grub
you could, but why ?
i dont have a flashdrive or usbdrive at the cabin
and no cdrom & cd either ?

I never tried this, you can run a live cd from boot, though .. you would need an extra partition for the image and I can't predict if that won't get lost when partitoning and downloading, experiment to me so
Thanks for the advice.
I'd say so
can you possibly hang the hd to your current box ? via usb-adapter or such ?
i dont have any usb-drive
nah, I mean get ther "ssd" out the lappi and , via adaptor, hook it on your current box ( which might have cd ?)
i often did it in that way for weak machines, to have the basic install on a powerfull tower done in no time, re-insert hd in target-box and then getting a fitting end-install
The acer aspire one, is that a dual cpu ?
I think so, but better check with exact model on aspire, I'm no stock-bot :)
its a AO751h
intelatom, 1 core it seems
no rocket, true, use a lightweight install, maybe lubuntu
The ubuntu will work in lubuntu?
it's also ubuntu, but with a lightwight surface, ar you stay with 10.04 and use the netbook-remix (will be gone fronm natty on)
